review: We attended the training lunch on 3/20 at around 12p. It was relatively busy and since we had reservations we did not wait but a few minutes for the staff to explain the "free food stipulations". Our wait time to get a server and place our drink order was about 15 minutes, hence why they got 4 stars, however, the rest of our experience was phenomenal! Our server, Adam H. was super nice and attentive and did a really great job of interacting with the four of us and making sure our orders came out perfectly. 3 different occasions someone random came by and picked up trash for us without disturbing our party and our drinks were kept full. I highly recommend the simply grilled chicken sandwich- i chose this because it has the least amount of calories and fat (375 and 6) compared to the "healthy" salads and turkey burger (1100-1300 calories including fries and close to 60g of grams of fat EEEK). My fiance' had the burnin  love buger which was NOT greasy and featured fried jalapenos YUM. Definintely recommend this Red Robin and so happy we finally have one!!
I went to a Red Robin up north and have wanted to go back ever since. I'm so glad they're in Gainesville. The food is awesome and the service is great. I can't wait to go back!

Since they had just opened, I was expecting decent to mediocre service. However, it was great! The wait time was nothing and the hostess was very nice. The server was also fun to talk to and the food was awesome and came quickly. I had the 'Burnin' Love' burger and my friend had the turkey wrap. We both agreed the food was delicious. I will definitely be back!

Just had the milkshake here so far and it's great. Salted caramel, mmm. The place looked fairly crowded at noon on a Tuesday. Nice interior. Friendly service. I'll have to go back and try the burgers.

This place is really cool. They have really good burgers and their fries and other sides are all good too. I liked the fried jalapeños and fried mushrooms a lot. Their freckled lemonade is really good and is surprisingly with free refills. The server we had, Josh, was about as good as they get. I will say its not as cheap as you may expect, and the burgers are maybe a little smaller than I expected, but they are also really tasty and you can always add extra meat for like a dollar fifty I think. I am really looking forward to coming back to try something new because it all looked good. I think the fried mushrooms will be a staple here for me. Overall, I loved it and I'm really glad we finally have one of these now.

After my first experience there, I have to say that Red Robin isn't really "Yummm!"   For years, I have seen these commercials on television and wondered what the fuss was about.  We finally got one in the Oaks Mall and I was eager to try it out.   We ordered and the waitress brought us our burgers just a few moments later.  I was amazed by how fast it was, but after inspecting the food, we realized that they brought it to the wrong table (I made a point to let the waitress know that I touched the burger so unsuspecting neighbors didn't get my germs).  This was a simple mistake, so I didn't think much of it.   The waitress asked if we wanted our burgers "pink" or "done in the middle."  I am usually a medium-well kind of gal, so I went with done.  I didn't realize that "done" really means "charred."  I felt bad because I ordered it that way, but even a well-done burger should have SOME kind of flavor other than burnt.   The steak fries were good and I liked the fact that they were unlimited.  Unfortunately you can only eat so many fries in one sitting.   I was also unhappy with the price.  My husband and I could have gotten double the food at Five Guys for the same cost and been much happier.

I have been here twice and only give two stars instead of one because the food is edible. Prices are very expensive, especially for drinks (and I mean simple drinks like tea, coffee, and soda).  Both times I have been the tea and coffee have been some of the worst beverages served.  The food is also very expensive, and not very noteworthy.  While the fries are limited, how many can you really eat?  The burgers aren't that impressive, and for $30 for two people, I'd rather go to a nicer restaurant and eat something fresher and tastier. The burgers are bland, and the fries are nothing special either. One other thing, the restaurant is incredibly loud.  The kitchen and dishwasher room is open to the kitchen.  You can hear every dish break as if it was right next to you.  Very poor planning went into the layout.  Who wants to not only hear dishes being washed, but see the dirty room the dishes are going in and out of?

On of the worst visits to any restaurant ever. No substance to the clam chowder.  We waited 40 minutes for our burgers then walked out. The first visit there was very good.  This visit was very bad. NEVER AGAIN AT THE GAINESVILLE RESTAURANT.   A minus star if they had one.

I was really excited to get a Red Robin in Gainesville but unfortunately didn't have a great experience. The appetizer was just ok--definitely bought frozen and just fried in house. I ordered a burger (switched swiss cheese for cheddar) with sweet potato fries and my boyfriend a burger with steak fries. When our meal came out my burger came with steak fries. I mentioned it and the waiter said he would bring the correct fries out shortly. I took one bite of my burger and realized it had swiss cheese...I HATE swiss cheese. I sent it back, then my sweet potato fries came out, so they were getting cold while my burger was getting fixed. By the time my burger came out my boyfriend had finished eating. The whole meal was just ok and the confusion with the fries and the cheese really dampened the experience. Once you consider the prices, it's really not worth it.

After seeing their commercials on TV for years, I was happy to see that we finally got a Red Robin in Gainesville. The food is great! Burgers are one of my absolute most favorite foods, and Red Robin has some great burgers. Granted, they are a bit pricey, but well worth it. The couple times that I have been there, the servers were very friendly and the food was cooked to perfection. The only reason I took away one star was the price, which to be fair, I expected to be at that level. But with all you can eat fries, delicious burgers, and the strawberry lemonade with real strawberries, it was well worth it. I will definitely go back.

I too was pretty disappointed with Red Robin. I'll start off by saying that the service was excellent. I've been twice and both times, the waiters were very attentive and courteous. Unfortunately, that's about the only thing positive I can really say about Red Robin.  I've heard the burgers hyped by a lot of people from other areas and I simply don't understand it. They were not nearly as big as I had heard. Various types of burgers and different toppings that you can customize does not make this place "gourmet". The cooks seem to have a problem with undercooking. Guys... "medium well" does not mean bloody and raw, no matter how many times you cook it that way and we eat it instead of sending it back. In the end, the burgers really don't taste much different than Burger King, who I don't like. The only slight saving grace from making it taste exactly like BK was the toppings. At least the chili is pretty good and has a nice spice to it. The fries may be bottomless (though I was never asked if I wanted more), but they're just your average steak fries, nothing special.  Lastly, the price for alcohol is absolutely insane. $4 for a bottle of domestic? WTF is that? For that matter, the price for those burgers is too high as well.  Simply no motivation to ever go back to this place.

It gets 2 stars for the ambiance-- which is awesome. Neon, movie posters, great looks. Food is horrible... tastes decent going down, but for me comes back up a few hours later. Been there 3 times, gotten sick 3 times.
This place was fantastic!  It is a bit pricey but the food was excellent and staff was prompt in service.

I hadn't gotten around the trying Red Robin since I generally avoid the mall like the plague, but we were in the area before a movie over at Gators 4 Cinemas and decided to give it a try. The place was packed but we were able to get seated quickly in the bar area. Our waitress took our order quickly and kept the drinks refilled without us having to ask. So all of our interactions with their staff were positive.   The food however wasn't anything to write home about...I'm not even sure if it's really worth writing a review about either. Hamburgers are their thing, so you'd think they'd really pay attention to the quality of their beef. Unfortunately we found their beef to be under seasoned and rather bland tasting. Like Five Guys, Red Robin masks mediocre beef with tons of toppings. Since I get my burgers with very few toppings I pay attention to the flavor of the beef. We used their special house seasoning to try and give it some flavor, but that really didn't help a whole lot.    You'd get a better sandwich a couple doors over at Ruby Tuesday or over at BJ's. Red Robin is barely a step above fast food, but with the same prices as the aforementioned competition.  The atmosphere is like any other boring TGIF, Apple Bees, Chili's kind of American restaurant. They thew some random crap at the walls, put up screens to watch sports on, and serve boring food. The place is also rather loud, and not at all relaxing to eat at.  I'm not sure why, but I expected more.

Glad I gave it a chance despite some of the negative reviews here. I ordered the Blue Ribbon Burger which was very delicious. The all you can eat fries were very tasty also. I wanted something sweet so I ordered a strawberry milkshake which was very satisfying to my sweet tooth. The staff was very friendly and the service was great. Our server was very enjoyable and great to deal with. The atmosphere was very lively and fun. I think the use of the word "gourmet" is a bit of  a stretch but my burger sure was very good. I would definitely return here for a good burger anytime.

My husband and I thought we'd give the Gainesville location a try as we have eaten at Red Robin in various locations in the US.  I was disappointed to say the least.  We went for a late lunch, early dinner on a Saturday afternoon.  The restaurant was busy, but not crowded.  We were seated at a table next to the kitchen.  Our service lacked to say the least.  Our waitress was totally clueless.  Brought my salad with NO dressing at all.  After 5 requests, she finally brought it.  My husband was finished with his meal.   I will try this location one more time, and will advise if it my next experience is any better.  Food is acceptable, but other Red Robin's food was better.   Sorry red robin.  I do like your food, but not at this location.

This was out first visit to this location. I will start by saying the service was excellent. The food was very good but it seemed to take a little while and wasn't cooked well done as requested. I had assumed that's why it was taking so long but I guess not. None the less would recommend this location as I am a big fan of there burgers, and all you can eat fries :-)

Crowded as hell. Noisy. Obnoxious promos. Lame burgers. BUT! Come anyway. Sit in the bar, get an Irish beer shake. Drink it slowly. Eat the steak fries with mayo or bacon aioli. Talk smack with the bartender. Laugh at the ESPN show. Get another Irish beer shake. Be goofy with the stranger next to you. It'll be a good night. (Don't get non-burger food here unless you really enjoy being on your toilet.)
A very good burger. Clean establishment. There was no wait. Friendly server. Give them a try. See what you think.

OMG!  What a freakin' great burger!  I'm a tough one to be impressed by burgers.  I'm usually disappointed because my hubby makes really really good ones.  But the sauteed 'shroom burger was incredible.  Juicy, flavorful, not too terribly big that you couldn't finish it or take a bit comfortably.  I switched out the roll for a cibatta because I just like them better. I usually favor local restaurants over chains, but I think this one may be an exception.  I'll need more data before I know for sure.  When are we going again?

Time for an update on one of the few places I'll eat a burger at. I made it a point to come here because I had a coupon to redeem. The same pleasant attitude I had previously received from a server was obviously not an error. Seems like all the employees here are well trained in customer service. Zale was my server this time  and I couldn't of asked for better service. I ordered the Guac Bacon Burger which was quickly presented to me. An excellent burger except that the guac was more of a spread. You won't find any chunks in there. The ciabatta bun I requested was a better choice than the sesame seed it usually comes on. As usual the home made bottomless slaw was fresh and crunchy. LOVED the choice of tunes they had playing.

Standard Red Robin food -- which is good -- but the service here is terrible. I've been three times and each time, our food was at least a half hour coming out. On two of those, the server took more than 15 minutes to take our order. The management was very nice and apologetic each time but I've given up on these guys.

This was my first visit to any Red Robin restaurant and not sure what to think. First impression I suppose was that its interior reminded me much of many other chain restaurants: lots of pop-culture photos and posters up on the walls, nice lighting, upbeat, friendly waitstaff. The emphasis is on burgers and they also seem to have a full bar and a variety of drink specials--much like Chili's or several other chain places I can think of do.  I ordered a burger that was covered with a teriyaki glaze and pineapple and cheese--Hawai'ian-inspired and much better than perhaps it sounds. Still, it seemed small and the fries that came with it were good but not really enough, either, for lunch. I also had their signature strawberry lemonade which was ok but not for $4, even with unlimited refills. I should have just ordered Coke instead. Like Burger-Fi out on Archer, the concept here is good and the food isn't bad but not exceptional, either. Just mediocre and pretty much what one would expect for a mall restaurant. I would be surprised if it draws many people in who are not coming to the mall anyways, but it will no doubt provide Ruby Tuesday with some competition.
This restaurant has repeatedly went out of their way to ensure that our allergies were noted and the food came out perfectly. This has become one of the most requested restaurants by our kids.

first time try as it was openned recently. Their steak was very fresh and juicy. Grilled with a flavor of smoke. So yummy. Nice environment for sports fans. don't like the fried onion ring, too thick.

The bacon cheeseburger and fries were the best I've had at any restaurant! I had a whole wheat bun and it was delicious too which is a surprise since sometimes wheat buns aren't that good.  The service was decent. It was a bit crowded. It wasn't too noisy to the point of being bothersome which is better than I can say for other Red Robin locations I've been to.  I tried the guac and chips appetizer and I will say the salsa was way too spicy for me. Interestingly the guac was a little spicy too. I don't recommend that for an appetizer but in the past I have had the hummus appetizer which is delicious. The onion rings were good when I tried them once as well. Needless to say I will be going back for that burger and fries, but will likely get a different appetizer.
Red Robin has been consistently good. The burgers aren't quite five star contenders but what do you expect from a chain restaurant. Also, they have good sweet potato fries.

Back again and very impressed. I had their new Southern Charm Burger. Excellent. Service was amazing. Manny did a great job of taking care of us - even recommending something I'd never try (the campfire dipping sauce) and it was ready good.  I'll be back, and I recommend it.

After quite some time I finally decided to try this location out. It's a a nice space at the mall, although smaller than other locations since their malls are larger. Nevertheless, I was promptly seated and received my food at a decent time. It was also nice that the manager was able to help out, since just two  or three servers were on the clock at the time.  I ordered the Red's Tavern Double, along with cheese sticks and a strawberry shake. Everything was good, but I wish I had gotten more for what I paid for. They were very skimpy with the fries. I know I'm a little nutrition conscious but if I can see the bottom of the basket, I think I would want more fries than what you gave me. Overall, everything was nice, but the prices would keep me from coming often. There are many other joints where you can get a double burger just as good for a bit lower. But since I happened to be in the area with no better options, I enjoyed the experience.

My first time at red robin.   Wait time to sit was pretty short.  Once seated the server was a little slow to get to my table.  Once there he was friendly.  Another couple showed up order 5 mins after us and they got there burgers before us.  Not happy about that.  Server brought us fries.  Said "here some fries on me". Really?  They are bottomless. So you lied to me!  He kept bring new glasses of soda but left the old empty glasses.  Table was so full I had to ask to remove the empty plates. I should never have to ask for that.  Drove 35 miles to try the Doh!rings and wow they sucked. Burgers were decent but not worth my time or money. I will not be going back.

I was not pleased with my experience at this particular red robin in Gainesville, fl. Well this particular restaurant is in the mall....so of course they are extremely busy. but taking an hour to get food is a little bit ridculous. Our waitress wasnt the most accomodating. Now...lets talk about the food. I ended up getting the holiday burger. This is a turkey burger with sweet potatoe fries, lettuce mayo and cranberry sauce. I was like,....what the hey....its the holidays.....i must say it was not my favorite burger. And for 11.99...i could have purchase a regular menu item....lets discuss this bottomless fries...they are the thick cut steak fries....and very filling so it is difficult to eat a lot of them but if you are in the mood for fries make sure you order your next round prior to finishing what you have.......many of the burgers range from 9.99 to 12.99...not too bad in price...they have a full bar if you are in the mood for adult beverages....not my favorite place but its fun for kids.

Decent burgers for a chain.  You aren't going to go out of your way to eat here, but if you find yourself at the mall it's definately a step above the food court.  The bottomless rootbeer float did not disappoint.  Our server was friendly, but took the "don't tell my manager but I'll get you this special thing" approach a little too many times with us and every table around us.  We get it.  You want a tip.

A server named Thom gave us the wrong ticket. It was six dollars cheaper than our actual ticket. We tipped him nicely, but it still didn't cover the actual meal price. So on our way out, he chases down my mom in a crowded parking lot and demands the $.53 difference, acting like she had mistakenly short changed him from the start. Interestingly enough, he had conveniently misplaced the ticket he gave us.  We will not be returning.

It's definitely a draw when you're offered a birthday burger reward (conveniently delivered to your email inbox no less), but slow service may not make up for the free burger. We sat at the table for a while before our orders were taken. The place wasn't that busy. Hard to say if it's a pattern.  The sweet potato fries didn't look/taste fresh. The Red Tavern was solid. I do love that they have fresh, steamed broccoli as a side.

Get the Royalty Rewards. Free birthday burgers make my year. A new addition to the menu is the Red's Tavern Burger, which is a cheaper option. Since I'm nowhere near El Indio or Mac's, Red's Tavern double is my new staple burger when I get a craving.
The Crab Cake Burger is a great addition to the menu! However my order initially came out wrong...they lost a few stars for that!
Good service, good space, plenty of choices, and it is a nice place to watch the fight and enjoy their bottomless fries with sauce.

I ordered the Blue Ribbon. I'm not a fan of blue cheese, but the way they made the burger was really good. Our waitress was nice, so that's a plus. I do find it funny when the food comes out and before we even get a chance to take a bit, the waitress asks how the food tastes lol

First time for at this location. I do enjoy RR but I feel it's pricey IMO so I don't go often. I feel like Cheeseburgers and fries should be reasonable but that's irrelevant I guess. I had the Orange Cream soda and the Whiskey River barbecue salad. The drink was delightful but the salad was weak. Maybe I read the description wrong but it seemed really choppy and from the baggish. My table mates had cheeseburgers and shakes. They really enjoyed their meals. I won't be back unless someone else is paying, like this occasion.

We came in at 9:26 planning to order very quickly and get out because it was so close to closing. I don't normally do this, but we had a 4 hour breastfeeding class and we were exhausted and starving. It took about 7 minutes to get seated because all of the servers pointed the poor hostess to different tables so they couldn't take us and loudly argued about how they didn't want to take us. The hostess apologized and it took another 10 minutes for a server to come take our order. We offered to get a to-go order, but they told us it was okay.  The server complained profusely to us and the neighboring table about how terrible the day was and how they are closing early. I ordered the southern charm and I understand it was late, but I had the soggiest burger I've ever had. I don't even understand where the water came from, it was like they soaked the bottom bun in water. Hence the one star, a gourmet burger place should not have a soggy burger. My husband had the pig out tavern double. It had the same amount of meat that my single had, just in two patties. His fries were cold and hard. I was able to let some things slide because of the time, but the soggy burger just ruined it for me :(

Been to many of these in Seattle. This one was about average I guess. The place was really, really, like really loud. So forget taking a date here, and expecting to have nice conversation. You can, of course, send text messages across the table, it's' what we ended up doing. The service was slow, but the server was friendly. We got the chips and dip for an appetizer ... they were absolutely amazing, but were a really, really small serving size. While I was waiting, I thought I would use my device ... wrong ... who ever heard of a place, especially near a college campus with 50,000 students, that does not have Wi-Fi? I mean really, that is like so last century. I had a burger, the sauce, ok, not great, completely soaked into the bun making it soggy. If they had toasted the bun, or put on less sauce, or here is a tip, put the sauce NEXT to the meat, and THEN put the lettuce on top to prevent soaking into the bun, that is what I do at home and it works great. Anyway, I really didn't need the carbs from the bun anyway, so cool, they helped me save a few hundred calories. The raspberry tea was really good, and the non-sugar variety, is only about 10 calories a glass. Also great way to save calories. All in all, it could have been better, but certainly could have been worse, like, for instance, if I had gone to McDonalds. Here is a tip if you end up here, you can probably pick up the Wi-Fi from the Oaks Mall. But the Wi-Fi name has nothing to do with Oaks, or any permutation thereof, it is TheClub I believe. Go figure. Security by obscurity.

First of all I know they are a burger joint but I went for a quick meal. I had a salad not  only did they take 20 minutes to bring it out to me but it was a small portion and unappetizing. I have to say when it comes to salads they have not cornered the market. Our waiter was very nice and attentive
Amazing burger and steak fries. Try the campfire sauce because it is delicious. Our server was so sweet and really took time to share info about the different options. Great place to eat!!!
It's alright, usually I have a better experience than the one I had today. I usually love the big tavern burger, but today's left something to be desired. Their gluten free bun is also not good.

Very upsetting to post have to post this. I have wheat allergies, ordered off their gluten free app, which is very user friendly. Brought my burger on a bun, can't have! They re made that which was great, However they claim their fries are fried in separate fryers. After eating most of my fries there were onion straws mixed in the bottom, can't have. So needless to say I got pretty sick. Love Red Robin, but the staff here can't be trusted when you clearly let them know of any food allergies. Btw, my wife doesn't have food allergies, so it isn't fair to her on why I don't like to eat at restaurants. Hope this may help anyone with food allergies. Called and talked to Brent the manager, he was very helpful.
Great burgers amazing bottomless fries.  The beer and food are a little prices but good for a special night out

Took some co-workers her for lunch. The service was good, the appetizers were good. Prices are on the higher side. Seriously $14 for a burger with fries? Ordered my burger medium got it rare. Should have sent it back to the kitchen.  They have a HUGE menu. Fish and Chips, chicken sandwiches, etc. They have a nice atmosphere, hip and fun. But if you want a good burger there are so many other choices in town, and Red Robin is now officially off my burger list.

Normally the experience here is fabulous. Tonight it was not. My son and I came in. The hostess was energetic and friendly and spent time talking with my 5 year old son. We sat down and waited a while. The hostess came back and took our drink order because I overheard the server complaining about being busy. The table next to us did not get their correct order. Finally our order was taken. The server seemed as if she was having a stressful night. You could see it in her face and hear it in her voice as she continuously apologized to the people at tables around us for incorrect orders. Our food arrived. I had to ask 3 times for napkins and silverware. Another server brought us some. Then our server did, saw we already received some, set more down, threw her hands up and walked away. She did check back with us 3 times, so that was good. Our buns were falling apart and the food was just okay. My sons apple slices looked old but he seemed not to care. I overheard the bartender that was trying to placate upset customers talking  to the manager about a couple that had been complaining and left. That was rude. When you pay for food and service, you expect it to be right! This was a situation that, looking back, gave us small signs that we should have just left and gone elsewhere.

I have never been to this restaurant but I gave been to the other locations in Daytona orlando area.  The service is great and fast and the food is great.  A little pricy but for what you are getting it is worth the price.  Bring a location to jacksonville.

This was an odd experience for me as I have been to Red Robin a few times with very little issue. I decided to cash in on the great birthday freebie which is essentially a free burger. Awesome!Come early as there are so many options to choose from, its bound to take you a while to pick the right one!  Okay so I entered the restaurant and was quasi-greeted by the host who told me he couldn't seat me right now because he wasn't on the clock yet. Excuse me? Okay that's cool. I glanced around the room and saw no other host or hostess so I wandered to a high top at the bar section. I was greeted promptly and given menus. I selected my burger and decided to opt for the lettuce wrap instead of bread with steamed veggies. I noticed that the folks around me didn't have their food yet but didn't think too much of it until about a solid 45 minutes passed. When my burger finally came I out it was on bread instead of lettuce. Kinda disappointing as I've already waited so long. So tack on another 5 minutes and the situation was remedied. I could tell the bar tender/waiter felt badly as he'd been apologizing to several patrons about the delays and send backs to the kitchen. Overall this was a sub-mediocre experience, but the food of course tasted great. With next year's birthday freebie, I promise I'll be back.

My daughter, daughter in law and I had lunch there and the burgers were excellent. It was very busy so it was a little bit long on service but waitress was good.  The sweet potato fries were great. We would all go again.
High $, slow, low quality and under cooked. Two burgers, fries and drinks ended up 35$!
Good burgers, great service! Garlic fries with a pale ale and the great black pepper angus medium cooked burger is the only thing can make you feel good!

We come a long way to eat here and normally love it however today wasnt the best time. I ordered a hamburger well done and it came back almost rare. The fries had a taste that the oil was old as it left a bad aftertaste. There wasnt enough servers for what was in the restaurant. Service was good for us but food was sub par. Sad because we love this place. Its just so far to drive i dont know if we will be back.

Excellent service, waitress was kind enough  to get fries while we were waiting for our food. Smoky Pepper Burger was best burger I've had in Gainesville, in quite a while. The raspberry lime lemonade really hit the spot. Will definitely return. The ability to pay your bill and check out on your own, is fantastic!

Delicious Dinner!  Very convenient location.  Clean restrooms.   Fast friendly service.  Our server Chad S was very professional, helpful, and kind.   I'd recommend this location without reservations.   Fast, fantastic food for a fair price - and friendly service! ANY of the burglars are Great!  The Yukon chips are my favorite!  They are large, ruffled, homemade potato chips.   The tea was freshly brewed and the dining area was clean and not too noisy.  Quiet enough to have a comfortable peer discussion over dinner with a colleague.  Enjoy! Update 9/6/16.  Excellent meal as before and really enjoyed the Yukon fries. Our server today was Brandon and he was sufficient, professional, and very very nice. Recommended for anyone that wants a great meal at a fair value with friendly service! We even got a visit to our table by the manager ensuring that everything was just wonderful.  Great service Kew!

Never had a bad burger or chicken sandwich fm any RR! My kids love & beg to come here. I love the more options for kids than other places!! Staff are friendly and only had one slow (maybe new) waiter on one of our visits. 98% of the time I try the new burger. Best fries esp when they have parm/garlic/olive oil on top or dipped in garlic aioli sauce. All washed down w a strawberry lemonade. Join their club and add your kids school to earn points. Pay at the table makes it quick.

Food is okay. I have had better burgers around town line in square 1 burger. Service was terrible. Waited for ever to get refills on anything we asked. Finally, when I got my burger, the lower bun was Soggy and had spaghetti stuck to it!!!!  Spoke to manager and they were sorry! They gave us a $20 discount and we still paid  $78 for one appetizer, 3 burgers, and two orders of kids chicken nuggets. Oh, did I mention cops had to be called to calm two customers dispute!!!

Red Robin is actually a great place to hang out and have a beer and burger while the wife is shopping at the mall. I've found this wonderful loophole to shopping with my wife. She is happy because I went to the mall with her and I spend 30 minutes shopping and two hours watching sports and enjoying a few adult beverages. The drinks are expensive which is to be expected at a chain restaurant located at the mall. The food is decent but nothing special. Sometimes that burger really hits the spot and sometimes it doesn't. The service is normally friendly and alright. The place does get super busy at lunch and dinner time.

Just had the waffles and fried chicken sandwich with angry orchard honey and relish. It was messy but delicious. Unlike anything you'll find anywhere else. Colton at the bar was very friendly and I'm glad he suggested this sandwich.  The manager Brent stopped by to make sure all was well.  If you are looking for a great place to hang or to rest after walking through the mall this is it.

If I didn't like the food, I don't think I would return to this specific location.  I called in my order, but the food was cold. The fries were stale--and for a place that always offers unlimited fries I was jipped in the quantity--but more bothered by how they were cold/stale.  I dont think i would return to this specific location.

Went here on Friday night with a small group after scaring children at a local haunted house. It was rather late, so the pickings of places open in Gainesville are kind of small. Any later and we would have been subjected to Perkins... Anyway, this was my first time to any Red Robin. The inside is nice, and the menu has a number of options for someone who can sometimes be picky. Prices also seem to be reasonable for what you get. I ordered the Royal Red Robin and their Freckled Lemonade, which is basically just a lemonade with strawberry syrup and some sliced strawberries on top. Nice, but it is something that I would only order once in a blue moon... I am now done with strawberries for a while.  The burger was quite good, and they got the egg right (the yolk should be runny. You want it to come out as a liquid so that it creates its own sauce on the burger!) The fries that came with the burger are also decent. Service was fair. Our server had to come and help us with their payment system a number of times because it only sort of work properly.  In town here, I would go back from time to time. However, because this is a chain it is not a place I would typically go when travelling. I don't do "the same old familiar" when travelling... I look for the local places that I can't get back home. However, for gourmet burgers in town, they are towards the top of the pile.
Do not go here waited for nothing servers going by and not helping waited 10 min just for a drink that i didnt even get if i could give no stars i would

I had the Teriyaki chicken sandwich.It was delicious. It has grilled chicken breast, pineapple, lettuce, cheese, tomato(I had it sans tomato), mayo and of course the teriyaki sauce. Along with the sandwich I had the signature bottomless seasoned fries. The ice tea was so-so. It was a little on the watery side. The service was okay, nothing particularly outstanding. The guy was helpful, but I guess he had too many tables scattered about the place to be more attentive. I was glad to see that there is one finally coming to Jacksonville, at Town Center Drive.

We waited 9 minutes and a server named Andy saw us not being helped, came over to assist us and get us waters and went to find us a server. He identified the server who was supposed to come over to tend to us, but after another 13 minutes of where no one has come to us. We never saw our server. We ended up leaving unserved and no one at the front even acknowledged we were leaving.

OMG, we love Red Robin!!! We are addicted to the Bee's Knee's Chicken Sandwich.  I know it's a burger joint but their chicken is just as good. The Guiness Float is amazing too, check out their specialty burgers and chicken sandwiches along with their shakes.

The hostess staff set the pleasant tone for this visit. My friend and I were seated immediately and it was a pretty occupied dining area.  Gabriel, our waiter, introduced himself and asked if it was our first visit here. He oriented the establishment and the menu items. He asked about rewards familiarity and spoke about getting it started. He answered our questions about quality, wait time, content and menu suggestions with enthusiasm and knowledge. In under 10 minutes our selections were served once I returned from their "sanitary" men's room, and the Marco Polo and Bees Knees were hot, flavorful and delish!  Gabriel checked back with a different approach each time that was not mechanical or disingenuous. He was the same with each table that I could overhear.  The experience all encompassed was superior!

So it's the first week of school.  Lots of parents in town and can you believe it they got hit hard at opening. Short staff. Family had gone in while I parked. Hostess said I could just wander around looking even after I described who I was looking for. Really just wander around.? Chris the manager said they stagger their staff. Makes sense during the summer but not this particular weekend. Sat us then two other groups. Can you guess who got drink orders and appetizers way before us? Everyone. Had to ask for a server. Ordered apps and drinks and some fries with chipotle dipping sauce. The drinks came out. The guacamole and salsa was a small portion for 7 bucks. Maybe two ounces of each. Chips were good but not enough of the guac and salsa. Still no fries. Asked about the food and had a great view of the pass. Food was dying. Fortunately the female manager rolled in and started expediting. Food showed up, still no fries we ordered when we sat down, and no dipping sauce. My sandwich and the two burgers were good and hot. However I got 7 yes 7 fries with my sandwich. As did my son. The wife had twice as many. Manager finally brought fries then our waiter did. Guess they wanted us to get our fries. Birthday Sunday must of sat too since the whip cream was pretty wilted. Tim our waiter was obviously overwhelmed. We were his fourth or fifth table for him to serve. Again short staffed. Not sure it will be worth the drive again.

The burgers are great and they have really tasty healthier options as well. I've had their salads, Chicken sandwiches (have order with a traditional bun as well as wrapped in lettuce) and all have been really good. This is a great place to bring kids. The staff interacts with and is friendly to them, it's loud enough to where they aren't going to bother anyone else and their kids meals are not just prepared Kraft Macaroni.

Simply exceptional.  Fast friendly service.  Smiling faces from the staff. Our waitress was amazing. The food was hot and fresh. And who can resist unlimited fries.  Yes please keep em coming.  A manager even stopped by the table to see how everything was.  What is this kind of sorcery?  Hardly anyplace does this anymore.  Thank you Red Robin.  We will def be back.

The last time I went to Red Robin was almost 3 years ago and it was pretty good. The waiter was very nice but the burgers were awe full. It was small the meat tasted frozen and it was over cooked. They just really gone downhill

Very expensive ($15 for a burger and fries) and it was pretty bad.  The burger was surprisingly small, tasted like a cheap frozen patty, and came on a stale bun.  Felt like a rip-off.  Would not go back.
